line_1: But would ye learn, ye leisure-loving 'squires,
line_2: How best you may disgrace your prudent sires;

line_1: And dwells such mighty rage in graver 'squires?
line_2: And feels the tasteless breast equestrian fires?

line_1: From BAMPFIELD CAREW, to MOLL SQUIRES,
Not war like beautys, kings and squires,
line_2: But let us limit our desires,

line_1: — Go forward, cits! go forward, squires!
line_2: Nor scruple each, what each admires.

line_1: YE Irish lords, ye knights an' squires,
line_2: Wha represent our Brughs an' Shires,

line_1: YE Irish lords, ye knights an' squires,
YE Irish lords, ye knights an' squires,
line_2: To you a simple Bardie's pray'rs
